result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Sharlow, Danette Lorainne

records.addlTxt:
11:41 AM Defendant Danette Lorainne Sharlow in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Danette Lorainne Sharlow.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Thomas-Schmidt acknowledges information, waives reading. DEF stands mute to all counts, Court enters NG Plea to all counts. Court schedules.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:35 AM Defendant Danette Lorainne Sharlow not in court.   Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Danette Lorainne Sharlow. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Thomas-Schmidt indicates DEF reached out to Justice Point indicates ride was running late.  9:35 AM  OFF THE RECORD.  9:42 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD:   DEF appeared in court.   Atty Thomas-Schmidt indicates DEF waives prelim.  Court advised the DEF as to her right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived her right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Arraignment scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
